intro: Aster scaber f. minor, commonly known as the smooth aster, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, blooming in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
